description.para: Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections GetConnection API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Returns the connection ARN and details such as status, owner, and provider type.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a connection.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connection'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a connection.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connection'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection object. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.GetConnectionResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections ListConnections API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Lists the connections associated with your account.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
Filters the list of connections to those associated with a specified provider, such as Bitbucket.
The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

The token that was returned from the previous ListConnections call, which can be used to return the next set of connections in the list.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connections'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ProviderTypeFilter parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ProviderTypeFilter' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The maximum number of results to return in a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

The token that was returned from the previous ListConnections call, which can be used to return the next set of connections in the list.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ProviderTypeFilter parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ProviderTypeFilter' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
Filters the list of connections to those associated with a specified provider, such as Bitbucket.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Connections'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Connection objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListConnectionsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections ListTagsForResource API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Gets the set of key-value pairs (metadata) that are used to manage the resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you want to get information about tags, if any.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you want to get information about tags, if any.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.Tag objects. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections TagResource API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Adds to or modifies the tags of the given resource. Tags are metadata that can be used to manage a resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which you want to add or update tags.
The tags you want to modify or add to the resource.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which you want to add or update tags.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The tags you want to modify or add to the resource.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.TagResourceResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections CreateConnection API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Creates a connection that can then be given to other AWS services like CodePipeline so that it can access third-party code repositories. The connection is in pending status until the third-party connection handshake is completed from the console.
The name of the connection to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. Currently, the valid provider type is Bitbucket.
The key-value pair to use when tagging the resource.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ConnectionArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The name of the connection to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. Currently, the valid provider type is Bitbucket.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ConnectionArn'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The key-value pair to use when tagging the resource.

This cmdlet returns a System.String object. The service call response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.CreateConnectionResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections UntagResource API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Removes tags from an AWS resource.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from.
The list of keys for the tags to be removed from the resource.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The list of keys for the tags to be removed from the resource.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.UntagResourceResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS CodeStar Connections DeleteConnection API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection to be deleted. The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connection to be deleted. The ARN is never reused if the connection is deleted.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectionArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectionArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.CodeStarconnections.Model.DeleteConnectionResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
